summary: This document is an email chain from December 18, 2019, forwarding a tip from the National Human Trafficking Hotline (Polaris) to FBI case agents. The tip alleges potential recruitment of females for sex trafficking in New York and the U.S. Virgin Islands associated with Jeffrey Epstein, involving an adult female former employee of Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the tip, alleged to have requested recruitment of victims from NYC dance studios to go to his private island.

events.title: Hotline Tip Received
events.description: The National Human Trafficking Hotline received a tip (Case 00627791) regarding potential recruitment of females for sex trafficking associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Tip Forwarded to FBI
events.description: Polaris forwarded the hotline tip via email to FBI agents for investigation.

keyFacts: A tip was received by the National Human Trafficking Hotline on December 16, 2019, alleging potential recruitment of females for sex trafficking linked to Jeffrey Epstein.
The tip involved an adult female, approximately 40 years old, who allegedly worked for Epstein 10 years prior and claimed knowledge of victims being sexually assaulted.
The alleged recruitment method involved targeting unspecified dance studios in New York City to bring victims to Epstein's private island.
The tipster claimed the female former employee is on flight records to and from Epstein's private island.
The information was forwarded by Polaris to the FBI on December 18, 2019, for investigation by case agents.
